$description: Checkbox component tokens. Checkboxes are form controls allowing users to select one or multiple options from a set. These tokens compose primitive tokens into checkbox-specific configurations. Use checkboxes for: multi-select options, boolean toggles in forms, terms acceptance, feature toggles, and filter selections. ACCESSIBILITY: Always provide visible labels; never rely on checkbox alone to convey meaning.

size.$description: Checkbox box size (width and height are equal). Size should match surrounding UI density. Larger sizes improve touch targets and accessibility.

xs.$description: Extra small checkbox size (14px). Use for: compact data tables, dense lists, space-constrained UIs. May not meet touch target guidelines (44px) - consider for mouse-only interfaces.

sm.$description: Small checkbox size (16px). Use for: standard form density, inline options, filter panels. Common in desktop applications.

md.$description: Medium checkbox size (20px). DEFAULT size. Use for: most forms, settings panels, standalone checkboxes. Good balance of visibility and space efficiency.

lg.$description: Large checkbox size (24px). Use for: touch-optimized interfaces, accessibility-focused forms, prominent single options. Better for mobile devices.

xl.$description: Extra large checkbox size (28px). Use for: high-emphasis standalone toggles, large touch targets, accessibility requirements. Maximum visibility and tap target size.

borderRadius.$description: Checkbox border radius (2px). Minimal rounding maintains the traditional square checkbox shape while softening hard corners. Distinguishes from radio buttons (which are circular).

borderWidth.$description: Checkbox border width (1px). Thin border provides clear boundary without visual heaviness. Thickens visually when checked due to fill color.

icon.$description: Checkmark icon configuration. The checkmark should be proportional to the checkbox size and clearly visible.

xs.$description: Extra small checkmark size (8px). Proportional to xs checkbox. Keep stroke weight consistent for visibility at small size.

sm.$description: Small checkmark size (9px). Proportional to sm checkbox. Slightly larger than xs for better recognition.

md.$description: Medium checkmark size (10px). DEFAULT. Proportional to md checkbox. Clear visual feedback for checked state.

lg.$description: Large checkmark size (14px). Proportional to lg checkbox. More prominent check for better visibility.

xl.$description: Extra large checkmark size (16px). Proportional to xl checkbox. Maximum visibility checkmark.

strokeWidth.$description: Checkmark stroke width (2.5px). Bold enough to be clearly visible at all sizes. Consistent thickness ensures recognition across the size scale.

label.$description: Checkbox label configuration. Labels should be clickable to toggle the checkbox (larger hit area improves usability).

gap.$description: Gap between checkbox and label (12px). Provides clear visual separation while maintaining association. Label click should toggle checkbox.

fontSize.$description: Label font size (14px). Standard body text size for form labels. Readable alongside checkbox without overwhelming.

transition.$description: Checkbox state transition configuration. Quick transitions provide immediate feedback for user interactions.

duration.$description: Checkbox transition duration (100ms). Fast transition for snappy feedback when toggling. Should feel instant but smooth.

easing.$description: Checkbox transition easing (ease-out). Decelerating motion feels natural for check/uncheck toggle actions.

focus.$description: Checkbox focus ring configuration. Visible focus indicators are essential for keyboard navigation and accessibility (WCAG 2.4.7).

ringWidth.$description: Focus ring width (2px). Clearly visible ring around checkbox when focused via keyboard. Essential for accessibility compliance.

ringOffset.$description: Focus ring offset (2px). Space between checkbox border and focus ring. Prevents ring from overlapping checkbox border.
